name: Tarundeep Rai
biography: Tarundeep Rai is an Indian archer from Sikkim, awarded the Padma Shri in 2021 for his contributions to sports. He is a three-time Olympian, selected to participate in the 2024 Summer Olympic Games in both individual and team events.
childhood: Rai was born in Namchi, Sikkim, and is supported by a sports NGO, Olympic Gold Quest.
professional_career: Rai made his international debut in 2003 at the Asian Archery Championship. He won India's first individual silver medal at the 2010 Asian Games and has participated in the Olympics in 2004, 2012, and 2020. He faced a career-threatening shoulder injury in 2007-2008 but returned to win a silver medal at the 2010 Asian Games. Rai was part of the Indian men's recurve team at the 2012 London Olympics and competed in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, where he helped secure a quota place for the team.
